key_points: Tom Brady is considered the greatest quarterback in the game, solidifying this reputation with a Super Bowl 55 win with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers.
The Super Bowl 55 win marked Brady's seventh, the most in NFL history, with his previous six wins as a member of the New England Patriots.
Brady holds the record for most Super Bowl appearances, with 10.
He has won the most Super Bowl MVP awards, totaling five.
Brady set records for the most Super Bowl pass attempts (421) and completions (277).
With three touchdowns in Super Bowl 55, Brady's total Super Bowl touchdown passes reached 21, the highest ever.
He also holds the record for most Super Bowl passing yards, with a cumulative 3,039.
Brady set single Super Bowl records for most pass attempts (62), completions (43), and passing yards (505) in a game.
He leads with the most 300-yard passing games (4) and game-winning drives (6) in Super Bowl history.
Brady has won Super Bowls in three separate decades and is the oldest quarterback to win a Super Bowl at 43.
